When Amazon had a sale of the new Series 9, I jumped at the deal (much to my Spousal Unit's sarcastic amusement, but she's a confirmed low-tech girl, who only started texting 2 years ago!), and I'm very happy I did.It's smaller, less intrusive, and doesn't alert emergency call centers without my permission. (That was very embarrassing, by the way, as I'm a retired law enforcement officer, and some of the dispatchers still remember me!) The golf GPS function works reasonably well, though I still use a regular Garmin Golf GPS watch while caddying.I also prefer the ease of setup and the available watch faces fit my preferences better.Battery life is substantially less than the Ultra 2's, but the trade-off is worth it.  I'm keeping this one!

Author: Heidi
Product_Review: I love my watch! I got it to track my heart, exercise, and sleep data. The heart function is really why I got this watch and it alerts you when you have any heart issues whether you have afib, tachycardia or bradycardia and can be a life saver. This feature alone makes buying the watch a must. It also tracks your heart beat and will give you data by the minute each day if you so choose. In addition, if you have heart arrhythmias, you can show the ECG/EKG data to the doctor to prove you are having issues. Many times when you visit the doctor or the ER, you are not having the issues, or they go away, so they discharge you because they are not seeing it. Having the data on your watch makes all the difference as they can now see that you have issues. The exercise function truly does motivate you to exercise more often to meet your daily goals. It also sends encouraging messages once the goals are completed.  The sleep function tells you how much time you spend in each phase of sleep. If you've decided to improve your lifestyle through healthy eating, drinking, and exercise, it is nice to see how your health data improves over time which is very motivating. There are so many other features with the Apple Watch that I haven't used yet, but for me, getting it just for the heart monitoring data is money well spent.

Product_Review:
This is a nice, sleek watch. It has been a game changer for my exercise routine and essential for my overall health. And as someone with ADHD, this has been an amazing tool for locating my phone in a pinch.I have to take a lot of medication in a day. I put the information in the health app and set reminders, the watch reminds me until I long the medication. It’s been very helpful, and provides an easy way to record the time my meds were taken. I consistently have panic attacks, and my watch will notify me when my heart rate spikes, giving me enough time to relocate and try to ground myself. The breathe app is also a great grounding tool for me, the haptic feedback is a great thing to focus on when everything else around me gets hard to process. Furthermore, it has made it easier to sleep! I have never completed a 5 min breathing exercise in bed, I always fall asleep before it is done. I just close my eyes and match my breathing with the vibrations, it eases the anxiety and gives my brain something to focus on when winding down. Speaking of the haptic feedback, that combined with the amazing sound coming from this watch has broken my habit of snoozing the alarm and falling back asleep. This watch also tracks my sleep, so I can get an idea of how long I sleep each night!For exercise, it has been nice tracking my steps. I had no idea that I walked up and down 27-30 flights of stairs at work! I knew I moved around a lot, but not that much. It serves as good motivation for recording my exercises at the gym. I now log everything and can create a nicer workout schedule.The battery life is great, and it takes maybe 45 mins to charge. I keep it on when I’m sleeping and charge it when I’m showering before work. It is water resistant, but I don’t think I’ll ever be comfortable with wearing a watch in the shower. So far there have been no scratches on the display, and I don’t have a screen protector on it. The only thing I don’t like is the wristband. I think it induces sweat that ultimately irritates my skin, so I habitually wipe it down with an alcohol pad. I’m on the lookout for a professional looking band that has nice airflow.
